events.body:
NACK

The tables are messed up and harder to maintain in mediawiki, and that is why markdown was explicitly chosen.

Hi @RandyMcMillan, markdown files are an acceptable format for BIPs (see https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0002.mediawiki#bip-format-and-structure).  There's no need to convert it to mediawiki.
Thanks for your proposal; closing per BIP author NACK.

@RandyMcMillan I would suggest a PR with the following fixup, if you'd like to do that (or an equivalent):

```diff
--- a/bip-0379.md
+++ b/bip-0379.md
@@ -411,7 +411,7 @@ descriptors and produce the same scripts.
 ## Reference Implementation
 
 A first reference implementation and documentation for Miniscript in P2WSH was originally published at
-https://github.com/sipa/miniscript .
+[https://github.com/sipa/miniscript](https://github.com/sipa/miniscript).
```
@achow101 @jonatack @murchandamus Posting this for when you realize that they aren't that difficult to maintain and that downstream rendering will break. sample rendering:

> Posting this for when you realize that they aren't that difficult to maintain.

Considering that GitHub does not even render your branch correctly at all, I would beg to disagree. 

Also, I did in fact write this in mediawiki originally and know firsthand how difficult it is to maintain. 

> downstream rendering will break.

As this repo is the ground truth for BIPs, and afaik, is not intended to be be consumed by downstream, that does not seem like something that bip authors should be considering.
